About 690,000 resultsThe August 2021 issue of Vogue features Margot Robbie on the cover, styled in a stunning gold trench coat from Chanel's Fall/Winter 2021 collection, photographed by Lachlan Bailey.
Cover Details
Model: Margot Robbie, the Australian actress known for her roles in films such as "Barbie" and "The Suicide Squad," makes her solo debut on the cover of British Vogue for August 2021. 2
Photographer: The cover is lensed by Lachlan Bailey, a renowned fashion photographer known for his striking and intimate portraits. 2
Styling: The cover styling is done by Clare Richardson, who has dressed Robbie in a gold trench coat that exudes elegance and sophistication. The cover story is titled "If I Want Something, I Have To Make It Happen," reflecting Robbie's determination and ambition in her career. 2
Fashion Elements: In addition to the gold trench, the cover features designs from various high-end labels, including Alexandre Vauthier, Loro Piana, Gilda & Pearl, Eres, Roberto Cavalli, Frame, La Perla, Victoria Beckham, Isa Boulder, and Michael Kors Collection, showcasing a blend of luxury and contemporary fashion. 1
 This issue not only highlights Margot Robbie's fashion-forward look but also encapsulates themes of empowerment and ambition, making it a significant edition in Vogue's lineup.

        "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org\",\"@type\":\"NewsArticle\",\"articleBody\":\"As is the way at Vogue, the August issue brings with it our first proper look at the season to come. Idling at the crossroads of trepidation and freedom, the urge to go out, the desire to dress up, to look ahead to autumn and imagine a life built on the alluring combination of plans and spontaneity once again, are all strong. But perhaps our feelings remain a little tempered by recent experience, too. Certainly, it is a more carefree life we crave, but one that allows our increasingly mindful ways of engaging with fashion to flourish.\\nSubscribe to British Vogue\\nSo it is only fitting that this issue is all about an important style concept: the key look. With many of us having stepped off the treadmill of \u201cnormal\u201d life for a time, as we consider our fashion choices for the months ahead, enthusiasm and discernment are important watchwords. You\u2019re in good hands. You will find the first edits of the coming season\u2019s definitive looks from the leading houses and designers. Whether you\u2019re drawn to newly refined elegance, or prefer a liberated ease, our editors present fashion\u2019s road map for the months to come.\\nThe emphasis is on quality \u2013 something that Gabriela Hearst understands instinctively. Newly arrived as artistic director at Chlo\u00e9, she talks to Sarah Harris about her plans for the French house and why sustainability will sit at the core of all she does. Switching cotton linings to linen, streamlining the production of handbag hardware, removing energy-sucking digital screens from the retail experience, and using four times as much sustainable material in her soon-to-launch\\ndebut collection as the label\u2019s previous output, she\u2019s made a great start.\\nElsewhere, we find a delicious transformation by model-turned-actor Iris Law ahead of her first role in the forthcoming Sex Pistols TV biopic, and Olympic hopeful and record-breaking sprinter Dina Asher-Smith in full fashion mode. By Edward Enninful30 June 2021
Lachlan BaileyAs is the way at 
Vogue, the August issue brings with it our first proper look at the season to come. Idling at the crossroads of trepidation and freedom, the urge to go out, the desire to dress up, to look ahead to autumn and imagine a life built on the alluring combination of plans and spontaneity once again, are all strong. But perhaps our feelings remain a little tempered by recent experience, too. Certainly, it is a more carefree life we crave, but one that allows our increasingly mindful ways of engaging with fashion to flourish. 
Subscribe to British VogueSo it is only fitting that this issue is all about an important style concept: the key look. With many of us having stepped off the treadmill of “normal” life for a time, as we consider our fashion choices for the months ahead, enthusiasm and discernment are important watchwords. You’re in good hands. You will find the first edits of the coming season’s definitive looks from the leading houses and designers. Whether you’re drawn to newly refined elegance, or prefer a liberated ease, our editors present fashion’s road map for the months to come.
